intro: Mesembryanthemum erectum, commonly known as the upright ice plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Mesembryanthemum erectum is also valued for its ability to withstand drought conditions due to its adaptive water-storing tissues.
